items.title: US government shutdown live: Senate votes down Democratic continuing resolution as speaker says House will return next week
bullets: • US Senate votes down Democratic continuing resolution to fund government
• Senate votes 47-53, with all Republicans opposed, to reject Democrats’ counterproposal
• Upper chamber now voting on House-passed Republican short-term spending bill
• House of Representatives will not return to Washington until next week

items.title: US national parks to remain partly open during government shutdown
bullets: • Parts of the US government shutdown will remain open to the public
• More than 9,200 employees will be furloughed, reducing staff by 64%
• Only workers deemed necessary to protect ‘life and property’ will be on duty

items.title: Supreme Court lets Fed Governor Lisa Cook keep job pending oral argument in January
bullets: • Supreme Court allows Fed Governor Lisa Cook to remain in her post pending oral arguments in January
• Trump has repeatedly asked federal courts to allow him to terminate Cook from the Fed's Board of Governors without delay
• The White House has cited claims that Cook committed mortgage fraud as his reason for firing her
• Cook denies any wrongdoing in connection with statements she made in applying for mortgages on two homes she owns in Michigan and Georgia

items.title: White House puts hold on $18bn for New York rail tunnel and subway expansion
bullets: • $18bn to fund a new rail tunnel beneath the Hudson River between New York City and New Jersey and expanded Second Avenue subway project

• White House budget director Russell Vought said the step was taken due to the Republican administration’s belief that the money was “based on unconstitutional DEI principles’, a reference to diversity, equity and inclusion

items.title: Federal Reserve governor will keep her job despite Trump’s bid to remove her
bullets: • Donald Trump's bid to remove US Federal Reserve chief is deferred until January
• Trump has been trying to exert greater control over the central bank's board of governors
• He is the first president to fire a Fed official in an attempt to remove her from the post

items.title: Microsoft sales chief Althoff gets new role as CEO of company's commercial business
bullets: • Judson Althoff, Microsoft's top-ranking sales leader, has been promoted to a bigger role as CEO of the company's commercial business
• Most of Microsoft's revenue comes from commercial offerings such as productivity software subscriptions and cloud-based Nvidia chips for running artificial intelligence models

items.title: Microsoft launches AI and productivity software bundle for consumers
bullets: • Microsoft will stop promoting a consumer subscription for artificial intelligence services
• The software company introduced Copilot Pro at $20 per month in early 2024
• The new Microsoft 365 Premium tier essentially combines both and will cost $19.99 a month
• Microsoft 365 Family goes for $12.99 each month

items.title: ‘This is their shutdown’: Democrats and Republicans blame each other as government closes down
bullets: • Democratic leaders say the blame for the shutdown lies solely with Donald Trump and the Republicans
• Chuck Schumer: “We’re going to say, ‘Go tell Trump he’s the one doing it.” Republicans say Democrats have prioritized taxpayer-funded benefits for illegals

items.title: UK once again demands backdoor to Apple’s encrypted cloud storage
bullets: • UK Home Office demands Apple create a means to allow officials access to encrypted cloud backups
• Apple says it has never built a back door or master key to any of its products or services and never will
• Apple withdrew its most secure cloud storage service from the UK in February

items.title: States sue Zillow, Redfin for alleged antitrust violation in online rental housing
bullets: • Attorneys general from five states sue Zillow and Redfin over a February deal

• New York Attorney General Letitia James: "Zillow's attempt to shut down its competition could drive up costs for advertisers and leave renters with fewer options" The lawsuit follows a similar one filed by the Federal Trade Commission

items.title: Afghans rejoice as internet returns after Taliban blackout
bullets: • Afghans rejoice as internet returns after Taliban government shut them down
• Local reporters say communications are resuming across provinces
• The government has not given an official explanation for the shutdown
• Last month a Taliban spokesman said internet access was being blocked "for the prevention of vices"

items.title: Israel 'tightens siege' of Gaza City as Hamas reviews Trump peace plan
bullets: • Israel 'tightens siege' of Gaza City as Hamas reviews US peace plan
• Defence minister warns thousands of Palestinians to evacuate southwards
• 45 people killed by Israeli fire in Gaza City on Wednesday, ICRC says
• Israel says offensive aims to secure release of 48 hostages still held by Hamas

items.title: How automakers are reacting to the end of the $7,500 EV tax credit
bullets: • Federal tax credits for new electric vehicles, used electric vehicles and commercial electric vehicles have been lost
• During last year's election, the Trump campaign made no secret of its disgust toward clean vehicles
• A new EV had to have its final assembly in North America, and certain percentages of its battery content needed to be domestically sourced

items.title: Munich Oktoberfest to re-open after fatal house fire and bomb threat
bullets: • Theresienwiese will re-open at 17:30 (15:30 GMT) after being closed for much of the day
• The venue has been the venue for more than 200 years
• It was shut while investigators probed a potential bomb threat linked to a house fire
• A 57-year-old man is suspected of starting the fire as part of a family dispute
• His body was later found at a nearby lake and police said he was carrying an explosive device

items.title: Hands-on with Fallout 76’s next expansion: Yep, it has Walton Goggins
bullets: • Fallout 76 has been my favorite online multiplayer game since its launch
• I've been surprised that it has actually grown over the past seven years
• It's still not for everyone, and in some ways, it has fallen behind the times since 2018
• The success of the streaming TV show based on the game franchise has attracted new players

items.title: Amazon launches 'price-conscious' grocery brand with most products under $5
bullets: • Amazon launches a new grocery brand aimed at "price-conscious" shoppers
• The new offering includes more than 1,000 items priced under $5
• It's not the first time Amazon has experimented with a budget-friendly grocery brand
• The move comes as Amazon's grocery business is in flux

items.title: Google’s Gemini-powered smart home revamp is here with a new app and cameras
bullets: • Google launches a new Home app with AI-powered Gemini intelligence
• The app will allegedly gain deeper insights into what happens in your home, unlocking advanced video features and conversational commands
• The new app apparently boosts speed and reliability, with camera feeds loading 70 percent faster and with 80 percent fewer app crashes

items.title: Jobs, travel, national parks - what impact will US shutdown have?
bullets: • Federal workers will not receive any pay cheques while the shutdown continues
• Air traffic controllers will continue to work, but will not be paid until the end of the year
• The shutdown could lead to long delays in flights and delays in travel across the country

items.title: In their own words: The Artemis II crew on the frenetic first hours of their flight
bullets: • Astronaut Jeremy Hansen: "There's enough time built in there to have a nap
• I’ve been practicing falling asleep
• So if the loops are quiet enough, and I get a minute, I'll try for a nap" The Artemis II mission is NASA's first Moon mission in more than 50 years

items.title: Supreme Court says Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook can stay -- for now
bullets: • Supreme Court blocks President Trump's attempt to fire Federal Reserve Governor Lisa Cook
• That means Cook can stay in her job at least until the high court hears arguments in January
• Critics had warned that allowing Cook to fire would have trampled on decades of research showing central banks function best when they're allowed to operate without political interference

items.title: Hundreds of celebrities relaunch a McCarthy-era committee to defend free speech
bullets: • Hundreds of celebrities relaunch a McCarthy-era committee to defend free speech
• The Committee for the First Amendment was founded in the 1940s to oppose the infamous House Un-American Activities Committee
• The current group is headlined by Jane Fonda, whose father was one of the early members

items.title: The billion-year reign of fungi that predated plants and made Earth livable
bullets: • Fungi may have shaped Earth’s landscapes long before plants appeared
• They may have partnered with algae, recycling nutrients, breaking down rock, and creating primitive ecosystems
• The discovery could help explain the origin of life in the world's most complex ecosystems

items.title: State of calamity in Philippines province as earthquake kills 69
bullets: • At least 69 people have been killed and dozens injured after a powerful 6.9 magnitude earthquake struck the Philippines on Tuesday
• The province of Cebu, which suffered the brunt of the damage, declared a state of calamity early on Wednesday
• Thousands spent the night on the streets amid repeated aftershocks

items.title: PEN America warns of rise in books 'systematically removed from school libraries'
bullets: • PEN America released its list of the most-banned books of the 2024-2025 school year
• The group counted 6,870 bans during the past academic year
• That's down from 10,046 in the past two years, but it's still a sharp rise from 3,000 in 2021-2023
• PEN calls it a "disturbing normalization of censorship"

items.title: Greetings from Kyiv, where you might stumble across Zelenskyy taking a stroll
bullets: • The Maidan, Kyiv's Independence Square, has been the heart of political change in Ukraine for more than two decades
• In 2004, a cop climbed on stage, knelt, and kissed the flag; a decade later, riot police snipers opened fire on demonstrators carrying wooden shields and European Union flags

items.title: What happens now that the government has shut down. And, a pricing deal with Pfizer
bullets: • Government shutdown begins after Senate unable to reach agreement on two competing funding bills
• Some ethics experts say that could violate the Hatch Act, which is intended to keep politics out of government work
• The last government shutdown lasted 35 days and was the longest in U.S
• history

items.title: Rep. Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., talks about the government shutdown
bullets: • Rep
• Mike Haridopolos, R-Fla., talks about the government shutdown
• NPR speaks with him about the shutdown
• Listen to the full transcript of this week's episode of Morning Edition on NPR's "This Morning Edition" at 7 p.m
• ET

items.title: Scientists may be closing in on dark matter’s true identity
bullets: • Scientists may be closing in on dark matter’s true identity
• LUX-ZEPLIN is rewriting the rules in the epic quest to uncover dark matter
• The world's most sensitive dark matter detector, LZ (LZ) hunts for dark matter from a cavern nearly one mile underground in South Dakota

items.title: Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world
bullets: • Webb spots first hints of atmosphere on a potentially habitable world 40 light years away
• Early data suggests hints of an atmosphere, but much remains uncertain
• Researchers have already ruled out a hydrogen-rich primordial atmosphere, pointing to the possibility of a secondary atmosphere that could sustain oceans or ice

items.title: Former DRC president Joseph Kabila sentenced to death in absentia
bullets: • A court in the Democratic Republic of the Congo has sentenced the former president to death in absentia
• The case stems from his alleged role in backing the advance of M23 rebels in DRC’s eastern provinces
• He was also ordered to pay about $50bn in damages to the state and victims

items.title: Scientists just solved Uranus’ coldest mystery
bullets: • For decades, Uranus baffled scientists because it seemed to have no internal heat
• New computer modeling shows the planet actually emits more energy than it receives from the Sun
• This subtle warmth suggests Uranus’ story is more complex than previously thought, offering fresh clues about its violent past

items.title: A plant compound might be the secret weapon against gum disease
bullets: • Morin-based powder, extracted from guava leaves, apple peel, and figs, can be slowly released with the help of polymers and serve as an alternative to antibiotics
• This could replace antibiotics, avoid side effects from existing treatments, and help vulnerable patients maintain oral health

items.title: Namibia deploys army to fight wildfire burning third of Etosha game reserve
bullets: • Namibia has begun deploying hundreds of soldiers to fight a fire that has burned through a third of Etosha national park
• The park in the north of the largely desert country is home to 114 species of mammals, notably the critically endangered black rhinoceros
• The fire had been burning since 22 September and had caused extensive ecological damage

items.title: The endangered cactus behind Mexico's sweet secret
bullets: • Barches of barrel cactus have been chopped up and seeped in vats of sugar until they're crystalized
• The Mexican government began banning the sale of acitrón in the early 2000s
• The biznaga cactus was found to be in danger of extinction due to overexploitation

items.title: Meet the woman steering Biden's bipartisan winning streak on Capitol Hill
bullets: • The White House has a long list of issues facing the nation's first two years of Congress
• President Barack Obama and his staff are working on a bipartisan agenda
• They say it's important to keep the public eye on what's happening in the U.S

items.title: Tropical Storm Imelda expected to batter parts of the southeastern U.S. this week
bullets: • Parts of the U.S
• are expected to be hit by Tropical Storm I-Bahamas
• The storm is expected to bring heavy rain to parts of the country
• Parts of South Carolina, Florida and Georgia are in the path of the storm
• The hurricane is a tropical depression

items.title: Is taking acetaminophen during pregnancy really associated with autism in children?
bullets: • President Trump suggested that taking acetaminophen during pregnancy is linked to autism in children
• Doctors disagree and say there's no strong evidence for that
• Tylenol could play a role in ongoing legal cases against the company that makes it
• NPR's pharmaceuticals correspondent, Sydney Lupkin, joins us in the comments

items.title: Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite'
bullets: • Meteorite collectors gather in Cincinnati this weekend for 'Meet a Meteorite' The rocks that hurtle from outer space and make it to Earth get a moment to shine
• At the Cincinnati Observatory later today, collectors will be showing off some of their treasures

items.title: How Kyrsten Sinema's decision makes Democrats' 2024 Senate map tighter
bullets: • Arizona Sen
• Kyrsten Sinema has always been a thorn in the Democrats side during her time in Congress
• She voted against her party more than almost any other member of Congress
• Now, the Democratic caucus has 48 Democrats and three independents

items.title: Madagascar’s president dissolves government amid youth-led protests
bullets: • President Andry Rajoelina has dissolved the government after youth-led protests over water and power cuts
• The UN says 22 people have been killed and more than 100 injured in three days of demonstrations
• Thousands of people have marched in the capital Antananarivo since demonstrations began last week

items.title: Wildfire in Namibia is contained, says PM, after criticism of response
bullets: • The fire broke out in Etosha national park, in Namibia's north, on 22 September
• The government said it suspected charcoal production next to the park was to blame
• It said 49 soldiers were being deployed to fight the fires and a further 500 on Sunday

items.title: West Africans deported from US to Ghana ‘dumped without documents in Togo’
bullets: • Eight to 10 west African nationals have been forcibly sent by Ghana to Togo, bypassing a formal border crossing, and then left on the street without passports
• Up to 28 people have arrived in the west African nation from the US so far in the deportation programme

items.title: Scared of spiders? Some former arachnophobes now are keeping jumping spiders as pets
bullets: • Thousands of jumping spiders are being flooded with requests from people who want to keep them as pets
• Social media videos of the spiders' antics have been viewed millions of times on YouTube
• Some women are trying to overcome their fear of spiders, while others are simply enchanted by their unexpected cuteness

items.title: Microsoft 365 Premium bundles Office and AI for the same price as ChatGPT Plus
bullets: • Microsoft is merging Copilot Pro and Microsoft 365 into a new Microsoft 365 Premium subscription
• It will be priced at $19.99 per month, the same price as OpenAI’s ChatGPT Plus subscription
• The subscription includes Copilot Podcasts, Deep Research, Vision, and Actions
• It also includes access to Office desktop apps for six people, 1TB of storage per person

items.title: Microsoft’s new Office icons are more curvy and colorful
bullets: • Microsoft is officially unveiling its new Office icons today, after they leaked earlier this year
• The icons have a modern design that’s more colorful and playful, with subtle changes
• This is the first major change to the Office icons since their overhaul in 2018
• The new icons are meant to represent a more connected design system

items.title: Ford and GM are buying their own EVs to keep the $7500 tax credit alive
bullets: • Ford and GM are working with dealers on short-term programs that would allow customers to continue to receive the tax credit on leased EVs through the rest of the year
• The automakers are hoping to soften the blow on car shoppers and keep up the momentum that many dealers saw in recent weeks

items.title: FTC accuses Zillow of paying $100 million to ‘dismantle’ Redfin
bullets: • FTC accuses Zillow of paying $100 million to ‘dismantle’ Redfin as a competitor
• Federal Trade Commission is suing the companies saying their “partnership” violates antitrust laws
• As part of that deal, Redfin also agreed to end its existing contracts with advertising customers

items.title: Sony brings audio sharing to its flagship noise-canceling headphones
bullets: • Sony is adding support for audio sharing and Google’s Gemini Live conversational AI assistant to its premium noise-canceling headphones
• The features are being added as part of new firmware updates for the two year old Sony WF-1000XM5 wireless earbuds and the Sony WH-1000X6 wireless headphones

items.title: CNN Political Briefing
bullets: • CNN Political Director David Chalian takes you inside the latest developments with insight and analysis from the key players in politics
• Suzan DelBene (D-WA) is laser-focused on re-capturing the House in 2026
• The race for New Jersey governor could be the sleeper contest of the year

items.title: The Axe Files with David Axelrod
bullets: • The Axe Files with David Axelrod is a series of revealing interviews with key figures in the political world
• This week marks the final episode of the series of interviews with Axelrod's friend, US Ambassador to Japan Rahm Emanuel
• Scott Jennings is well known as a conservative firebrand on CNN
